snippet: With 20 inches of snow in Boston over the weekend on top of the seven feet already on the ground, it is hard to remember when the snows began, and even harder to imagine when they might end.
abstract: More than two feet of snow falls on New England, paralyzing cities and frustrating residents; Boston Mayor Martin J Walsh warns of dangers from snow, including carbon monoxide poisoning, falling icicles and collapsing roofs; recent spate of storms have also been hard on region's economy.
lead_paragraph: With 20 inches of snow in Boston over the weekend on top of the seven feet already on the ground, it is hard to remember when the snows began, and even harder to imagine when they might end.

headline.main: Dangers, Frustrations and Snow Keep Piling Up in New England
headline.print_headline: Dangers, Frustrations and Snow Keep Piling Up in New England
